{"step_by_step_thinking": "Garre's osteomyelitis is indeed common in children and young adults, so option A is true. It is also caused by staphylococcus aureus, making option B true. The disease is characterized by a 'moth-eaten' appearance in radiography, so option C is also true. However, Garre's osteomyelitis is more common in immune-compromised patients, not immune-competent ones, making option D false.", "answer_choice": "D"}
